article.text: Akkar’s Sunni clerics condemned the murder of Sheikh Ahmad Abdel Wahed and his bodyguard and said there were some figures in the military institution seeking to cause a rift between the latter and the people. “There are some officers and members of the military institution who want to cause a huge rift between the institution and the people,” they sheikhs said in a statement. They added that they “will not allow any party to cause strife between the army and people,” and called for launching an “accurate and transparent” investigation and “severely punishing” the perpetrators.” The participants also called for a “general strike” on Monday in all Lebanese areas, the statement said, adding that Dar al-Fatwa announced it will stop working for three days to mourn Abdel Wahed and his bodyguard. Army troops shot dead a Sunni cleric on Sunday when his convoy failed to stop at a checkpoint in North Lebanon, the scene of deadly clashes linked to the uprising in Syria, a security official said according to AFP-NOW Lebanon
